name: Jira
description: This app integrates with JIRA to perform several ticket management actions
latest_tested_versions: Cloud Copyright (c) 2002 - 2021 Atlassian Corporation Pty Ltd.

device_url.description: Device URL including the port, e.g. https://myjira.enterprise.com:8080

password.description: Password (or API token if using Jira Cloud)

project_key.description: Project key to ingest tickets (issues) from

query.description: Additional parameters to query for during ingestion in JQL

first_run_max_tickets.description: Maximum tickets (issues) to poll first time

custom_fields.description: JSON formatted list of names of custom fields (case-sensitive) to be ingested

timezone.description: Jira instance timezone (used for timezone conversions for querying in ingestion). Refer to README

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using the supplied credentials

actions.verbose:
The fields parameter is provided for advanced use of the JIRA API. It is passed directly to the "fields" attribute in the JIRA API call. Values in the fields parameter will take precedence over the individual parameters such as summary, description, project_key, issue_type, etc.

When using the fields parameter, you are required to know how a particular field is inputted. To give a few examples (might differ in your JIRA environment):
  • The description of a ticket can be added as the first level key with a value like { "description": "ticket description" }
  • issuetype needs to be set as a dictionary like { "issuetype": { "name": "Task" } }
  • priority is set as { "priority": { "name": "Medium" } }
  • The project key is set like { "project": { "key": "SPLUNK_APP" } }

The vault_id parameter takes the vault ID of a file in the vault and attaches the file to the JIRA ticket.
Assignee and attachments by vault_id are addressed in a separate call to JIRA made after ticket creation.

The project_key parameter is case sensitive.

Default Values

Previous versions of the app set default values for priority and issue_type. This caused issues in situations where the default values used by the app were incompatible with the configured values. The app does not set default values anymore. If an optional field below is required by the JIRA environment and it is not provided, JIRA will give an error causing the action to fail.

This action will pass if a ticket is successfully created, even if it fails to assign the ticket, add an attachment to the ticket, or fill out the custom fields. These failures will be indicated in the result message.

Creating a subtask

The following fields parameter value can be used to create a sub-task, the key is to use the correct issuetype.
{"fields":{"project":{"key":"AP"},"parent":{"key":"AP-231"},"summary":"Sub-taskofAP-231","description":"Don'tforgettodothistoo.","issuetype":{"name":"Sub-Task"}}}

Caveats

Jira Cloud is removing the username field from user profiles in Atlassian Cloud sites. They are also removing username support from their product APIs for Jira Cloud. Since it is not possible to add an assignee to the Jira ticket using a username for the Jira cloud, we will use the user's account_id to add the assignee. Use 'lookup users' action to find out a user's account_id. You can use the [assignee_account_id] action parameter to add an assignee to the Jira ticket for the Jira cloud, and, [assignee] action parameter will be used to add an assignee to the Jira ticket for Jira on-prem.

project_key.description: Project key to add the issue to (case-sensitive)

assignee.description: Assignee username (required for Jira on-prem, assign required permissions)

assignee_account_id.description: Assignee user account ID (required for Jira cloud, assign required permissions)

actions.description: Gets specific attachments from a Jira Ticket (issue)
actions.verbose: The function will store specific attachments from a given Jira ticket inside the vault.

id.description: The key of the Jira issue

retrieve_all.description: If this is set to true all attachments will be retrieved from the issue (if the value is not provided, it will internally be treated as 'false')

container_id.description: The Container ID to associate the file with

extension_filter.description: Comma-separated list of file extensions to be returned from the issue

example_values: Successfully retrieved attachments from Jira ticket

actions.verbose:
Update an existing issue with the values specified in the update_fields parameter.
The results of the get ticket action may be used to obtain the update_fields parameters, including any custom fields present in the JIRA.
The JSON specified in the update_fields parameter requires the keys and the values specified in case-sensitive and double-quotes string format, except in the case of boolean values, which should be either true or false for example:
{"summary": "Zeus, multiple action need to be taken", "description": "A new summary was added"}

The App supports multiple methods for specifying the input dictionary. Please see the Atlassian documentation for the JIRA REST update issue API for more information.
The following formats can be passed as input:
  • Simple format; Create a dictionary with all the fields that need to be set:
    {"summary": "Zeus detected on endpoint", "description": "Investigate further"}
  • Using the update key; Some issue fields support operations like remove and add, these operations can be combined to update a ticket:
    {"update": {"components" : [{"remove" : {"name" : "secondcomponent"}}, {"add" : {"name" : "firstcomponent"}}]}}
    {"update": {"comment": [{"add": {"body": "test comment update"}}]}}
  • Using the fields key;
    {"fields":{"labels" : ["FIRSTLABEL"]}}

The app supports updating custom fields; depending on the custom field type, some operations might not be available. Review the jira_app playbook for examples.

The vault_id parameter takes the vault ID of a file in the vault and attaches the file to the JIRA ticket.

This action requires that either the update_fields parameter or the vault_id parameter is filled out. The action will fail if it either unsuccessfully attempts to add the attachment to the ticket or update the fields on the ticket.

Caveats

Jira Cloud is removing the username field from user profiles in Atlassian Cloud sites. They are also removing username support from their product APIs for Jira Cloud. Since it is not possible to update fields related to user resources in the Jira ticket using username for Jira cloud, we will use the user's account_id to update fields related to user resources. Use 'lookup users' action to find out user's account_id. Use 'get ticket' action results to obtain the [update_fields] parameters. Please find out below-mentioned examples for the [update_fields] parameter which is related to user resources.
  • Add assignee to the Jira ticket for Jira on-prem:
    {"fields":{"assignee" : {"name": "username"}}}
  • Add assignee to the Jira ticket for Jira cloud:
    {"fields":{"assignee" : {"accountId": "6d1ef6xy52z7360c267f27bb"}}}

actions.description: Get a list of user resources that match the specified search string
actions.verbose:
This action will be used to fetch the username of user resources for Jira on-prem and account_id of user resources for Jira cloud. The default value for [max_results] action parameter is 1000. The maximum number of users as specified by the parameter [max_results] will be fetched starting from the first.

Caveats

Jira Cloud is removing the username field from user profiles in Atlassian Cloud sites. They are also removing username support from their product APIs for Jira Cloud. Since it is not possible to search users using username for Jira cloud, we will use the user's display name to search users. You can use the [display_name] action parameter to search users for Jira cloud, and, [username] action parameter will be used to search users for Jira on-prem.

username.description: A string to match with usernames, name, or email against for JIRA on-prem (required for Jira on-prem)

display_name.description: A string to match with display name for JIRA cloud (required for Jira cloud)

max_results.description: Maximum number of users to return

actions.verbose:
In JIRA, the status transition of an issue is determined by the workflow defined for the project. The app will return an error if an un-allowed status transition is attempted. In such cases, the possible statuses are returned based on the issue's current status value.
The same is the case for invalid resolutions. Do note that some combinations of status and resolution values might be invalid, even if they are allowed individually.
To get valid values to use as input for the parameters:
  • For valid status values:
    • Log in to the JIRA server from the UI
    • Go to http://my_jira_ip/rest/api/2/issue/[jira_issue_key]/transitions
    • The returned JSON should contain a list of transitions
    • The name field denotes the status that can be set using this action
  • For valid resolution values:
    • Log in to the JIRA server from the UI
    • Go to http://my_jira_ip/rest/api/2/resolution
    • The returned JSON should contain a list of resolutions
    • The name field in each resolution denotes the value to be used

comment_visibility_name.description: Name of group/role able to see the comment

actions.description: Add a user to an issue's watchers list
actions.verbose:
Caveats

Jira Cloud is removing the username field from user profiles in Atlassian Cloud sites. They are also removing username support from their product APIs for Jira Cloud. Since it is not possible to add a watcher using username for Jira cloud, we will use a user's account_id to add a watcher for Jira cloud. Use 'lookup users' action to find out a user's account_id. You can use the [user_account_id] action parameter to add a watcher to the Jira ticket for Jira cloud, and, [username] action parameter will be used to add a watcher to the Jira ticket for Jira on-prem.

username.description: Username of the user to add to the watchers list (required for Jira on-prem)

user_account_id.description: Account ID of the user to add to the watchers list (required for Jira cloud)

example_values: Successfully added the user to the watchers list of the issue ID: CJ-3

actions.description: Remove a user from an issue's watchers list
actions.verbose:
Caveats

Jira Cloud is removing the username field from user profiles in Atlassian Cloud sites. They are also removing username support from their product APIs for Jira Cloud. Since it is not possible to remove a watcher using username for Jira cloud, we will use a user's account_id to remove a watcher for Jira cloud. Use 'lookup users' action to find out a user's account_id. You can use the [user_account_id] action parameter to remove a watcher from the Jira ticket for Jira cloud, and, [username] action parameter will be used to remove a watcher from the Jira ticket for Jira on-prem.

username.description: Username of the user to remove from watchers list (required for Jira on-prem)

user_account_id.description: Account ID of the user to remove from the watchers list (required for Jira cloud)

example_values: Successfully removed the user from the watchers list of the issue ID: CJ-3

actions.verbose:
Basic configuration parameters for this action are available in the asset configuration.

If the project_key parameter is set, polling will only ingest tickets (issues) from the specified project.

If the query parameter is set, polling will filter tickets based on the JQL query specified in the parameter.

If the first_run_max_tickets parameter is set, the first poll will only ingest up to the specified amount of tickets. If the field is left empty, the first poll will ingest all the available tickets.

If the max_tickets parameter is set, each poll will ingest only up to the specified amount of newly updated tickets. If the field is left empty, all tickets available at the time of the poll will be ingested.

During each polling interval, the app will query the JIRA server for tickets that have been updated since the previous poll. The app will check if each ticket has already been ingested, if it has not, it will create a new container for the ticket. An artifact will be created in the container that will have a selection of the ticket's fields listed as CEF fields. All the data of tickets will be added to the container's data field. Each attachment and comment on the ticket will be ingested as artifacts. All attachments will also be added to the vault. If a ticket has been previously ingested, the app will update the ticket container's data field. The app will also add a new artifact with updated fields and it will add new artifacts for new comments and attachments. If a comment on a ticket is edited, a new artifact will be added to the container.

For a poll now, the app will ingest as many tickets as specified by the container_count.

container_count.description: Maximum number of tickets to be ingested during poll now
